class.name: ConfigRange
class.brief: ConfigRange easily loads (min -> max) ranges from XmlConfigs
class.doc:
This class is a utility class used for quickly loading and aliasing range data in an xml config
**Headers** : ConfigRange.h

constructor.name: ConfigRange
constructor.brief: Load range data from an XmlConfig
constructor.doc: This class reads in data from an XmlConfig instance. The underlying xml should contain a node at *nodePath* like ``` xml <Range name="danny" min="100" max=":100" /> ```

argument.name: cfg
argument.doc: XmlConfig instance to load data from

argument.name: dMin
argument.doc: Default = 0 : default x value if not found in node

argument.name: dMax
argument.doc: Default = 0 : default y value if not found in node

argument.name: attrMin
argument.doc: Default = ":min" : attribute tag to search for x value

argument.name: attrMax
argument.doc: Default = ":max" : attribute tag to search for y value

method.name: toString
method.brief: Outputs the range as a human readable string

return.doc: A string representation of the range data in the format "( min -> max )"
